chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael L. Luchsinger was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $1300 has been applied. Remaining fine/costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.   Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 1:24 p.m. Defendant Michael L. Luchsinger in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Cts 3 & 4 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Smead. Statement by DE. No statement by DE. Court orders: 50 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, the Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction, $1870 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $42.50 blood draw costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 29 mo rev/29 mo IID, OWI Assessment, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court. Bond previously posted to be applied. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Preston James Smead in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Smead requests plea/sentencing date towards August.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 24, 2016 at 10:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Preston James Smead in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson states discovery has been exchanged. Atty Smead requests 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on April 19, 2016 at 09:15 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:05 PM: Defendant Michael L. Luchsinger in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   ADA argues for $1300 cash bond w/conditions.  No objection by Atty Smead.  Court orders $1300 cash bond as requested.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 09:15 am.
